description: System-generated unique key for the upfit record in this table (primary key for asset_upfit).
System transaction timestamp for the upfit entry in format YYYYMMDDHHMMSSmmm; represents record creation or update time; timezone not specified.
Code classifying the upfit work or job type; likely references a work code list used for costing or reporting; confirm with SME.
Human-readable description or resolver for workcode; likely stores the work code name for reporting; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the equipment item or package installed during the asset’s upfit; likely references an equipment catalog.
Text description or reference field corresponding to equip; likely the resolved equipment name used in reports; confirm with SME.
Short description of the upfit scope, quote, or vendor-provided service for the asset.
Free-text notes about the upfit work performed, packages installed, or special instructions.
Alternate unique identifier for the upfit record used by some modules; typically mirrors keyid; confirm usage with SME.
Flag indicating whether this upfit record is inactive or no longer applicable.
Original identifier from the source legacy system to support data lineage and cross-system traceability.
Name of the source legacy table from which this upfit record was migrated.
Total cost of the asset’s upfit, including equipment and installation labor; currency per tenant settings.
Standard cost field for this record, typically storing the same amount as upfit_cost for reporting consistency; confirm business rules with SME.
Total cost amount allocated under the specified workcode for this upfit.
